page.title: 11Home Life
page.content:
Most households have a vacuum cleaner, washing machine, fridge and freezer. Electricity, oil, solid fuel and bottle gas are used for cooking and heating. Many homes have central heating but retain the traditional open coal fire. Pressure cookers, food mixers and processors and microwave ovens are widely used for home cooking and baking. Jam, chutney and wine are made from home grown produce.
Home-based crafts include knitting, sewing, spinning, weaving, wood- turning and walking stick making. Television viewing (live and video), the playing of radio, tapes and records and reading are popular leisure pursuits in most homes. The County Library van, based on Workington (48km) circulates in the area every three weeks.
